params.taskDescription: Write a system of inequalities to model this situation.
params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow>
    <mo>{</mo>
    <mtable columnalign="left" rowspacing="4pt" columnspacing="1em">
      <mtr>
        <mtd>
          <mn>240</mn>
          <mi>h</mi>
          <mo>+</mo>
          <mn>160</mn>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mo>≥<!-- ≥ --></mo>
          <mn>800</mn>
        </mtd>
      </mtr>
      <mtr>
        <mtd>
          <mn>1.40</mn>
          <mi>h</mi>
          <mo>+</mo>
          <mn>0.50</mn>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mo>≤<!-- ≤ --></mo>
          <mn>5</mn>
        </mtd>
      </mtr>
      <mtr>
        <mtd>
          <mi>h</mi>
          <mo>≥<!-- ≥ --></mo>
          <mn>0</mn>
        </mtd>
      </mtr>
      <mtr>
        <mtd>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mo>≥<!-- ≥ --></mo>
          <mn>0</mn>
        </mtd>
      </mtr>
    </mtable>
    <mo fence="true" stretchy="true" symmetric="true"></mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\left\{ \begin{array}{l}240h + 160C \ge 800\\1.40h + 0.50C \le 5\\h \ge 0\\C \ge 0\end{array} \right.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription: Could he eat 3 hamburgers and 2 cookies?
params.detailedSolution:
The point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(3, 2)</annotation></semantics></math> is not in the solution region. Omar would not choose to eat 3 hamburgers and 2 cookies.

params.taskDescription: Could he eat 2 hamburgers and 4 cookies?
params.detailedSolution:
The point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>4</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(2, 4)</annotation></semantics></math> is in the solution region. Omar might choose to eat 2 hamburgers and 4 cookies.

questionSetStimulus: Omar needs to eat at least 800 calories before going to his team practice. All he wants is hamburgers and cookies, and he doesn’t want to spend more than $5. At the hamburger restaurant near his college, each hamburger has 240 calories and costs $1.40. Each cookie has 160 calories and costs $0.50.
